meanings.definition: A person who assists a clerk in their duties.
meanings.sent1: The subclerk helped the clerk organize files.
meanings.sent2: The office hired a new subclerk to support the busy clerk.
meanings.sent3: The subclerk accidentally spilled coffee on the clerk's desk.
meanings.sent4: In the busy office, the subclerk was the clerk's right-hand person.
meanings.sent5: The diligent subclerk quickly learned all the tasks from the clerk.

meanings.definition: To work as a subclerk in an office.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subclerk at the law firm to gain experience.
meanings.sent2: He will subclerk for a month during the clerk's vacation.
meanings.sent3: Subclerking at the busy office kept her on her toes.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to subclerk opened up new career paths for him.
meanings.sent5: They offered to subclerk temporarily until a new clerk was hired.

meanings.definition: The subclerk's responsibilities include filing paperwork and answering phones.
meanings.sent1: The subclerk diligently filed all the paperwork in order.
meanings.sent2: The office manager praised the subclerk for their phone etiquette.
meanings.sent3: The subclerk's phone skills were so good, they were nicknamed 'Phone Pro'.
meanings.sent4: In the office hierarchy, the subclerk was the paperwork wizard.
meanings.sent5: The subclerk's multitasking abilities amazed everyone in the office.
